commit_message:
Deprecate queues in favor of topics

Change-Id: Idd2122398b025ff8218f56b7f32eccafcef34c06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar-specs refs/changes/15/134015/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zaqar/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst. Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ====================================== Move away from Queues and use Topics ====================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zaqar/+spec/move-away-from-queues Queues are an expensive resource in terms of space used, guarantees and structure. Although they've been part of the API since the very beginning, we've come to the point where they are not needed anymore and we can stop relying on them as a first-citizen resource. Topics behave pretty much like tags. They don't require extra space and they're part of every message. In the case of Zaqar, they'd provide the same grouping functionality as queues but with fewer guarantees allowing users to opt-in to most of them - FIFO, for example. Problem description =================== Queue is first-citizen resource in Zaqar. In order to post a message a queue must exist. We've relaxed this constraint a bit by making queue's lazy and doing the creation under the hood. However, this did not solve the problem of occupying extra space with no good reason. Furthermore, it requires extra checks, for every operation, to verify whether the queue exists or not, which translates to more queries done to the storage. Proposed change =============== The proposed change is to remove queues in favor of topics. Removing queues will require several refactors in different areas, which are listed below: 1. URLs: All queue's and messages actions contain the queue name as part of the URL. Removing queues will require us to modify the URL in order to keep our API REST-friendly (see point 2). 2. Change Message Structure Topics are not a first-class citizen anymore, therefore they cannot be part of the URL (see point 1 above). Furthermore, they are part of the message and their purpose is to describe the group a message belongs to. Therefore, this spec prooposes to make the topic part of the message by adding a `topic` field to it. :: { "topic": "my-topic", "ttl": 300, "body": { "event": "BackupStarted", "backup_id": "c378813c-3f0b-11e2-ad92-7823d2b0f3ce" } } 3. Allow topics to be configured Queues have metadata to allow users for storing custom and zaqar-related configs. For example, queue's metadata is used to specify what flavor a queue should use. In order to preserve this behavior, metadata will be kept but as an optional resource. Users will be able to specify per-topic metadata and it'll be used by zaqar and/or the user just like they were previously used for queues. 4. Stats Refactor Current stats code is in the Queue's controller. This needs to be moved out of that controller to a common ground. 5. Deprecate previous Queue's guarantees Queue's provide some guarantees that need to be deprecated. For example, when trying to get the stats of a queue that doesn't exist, the API raises 404. These guarantees need to be relaxed now that queue's won't exist and topics won't be a first-class citizen. Drawbacks --------- This is quite a big change, it introduces huge breaking changes to the API and it'll require users to think differently about the it. Moreover, this change requires several changes in the client and it may also introduce some regressions that we need to very carful with during reviews. Alternatives ------------ Don't do anything, keep queues and stick with them. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: flaper87 Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Kilo-1 Work Items ---------- * Create a v2 * Make topics part of the message * Remove queues from the URL * Update the client Dependencies ============ None References ========== * http://blog.flaper87.com/post/people-dont-like-to-queue-up/ .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

commit_message:
Add min-disk and min-ram filters to list flavors

The Nova API allows user filter flavors by minDisk and minRam.

In addition, we shouldn't refer to openstackclient in nova
cli reference, we have special reference for openstackclient.

Depends-On: I3849cc2d73057170dc224fa86b724f5141ca9a23

Change-Id: Ia6b6225d1f826f91fe25bd3b12ae701d2440d028
Closes-Bug: #1647867
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/02/408402/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _nova_flavor_list: nova flavor-list usage: nova flavor-list [--extra-specs] [--all] [--marker <marker>] [--limit <limit>] [--min-disk <min-disk>] [--min-ram <min-ram>] [--sort-key <sort-key>] [--sort-dir {asc,desc}]``--min-disk`` Filters the flavors by a minimum disk space, in GiB. ``--min-ram`` Filters the flavors by a minimum RAM, in MB. ``--sort-key`` Sorts the list by the specified fields in the specified directions. You can repeat this option, but you must specify an equal number of sort_dir and sort_key values. Extra sort_dir options are ignored. Missing sort_dir options use the default asc value. ``--sort-dir {asc,desc}`` Sorts the list in the specified direction. You can repeat this option.
deleted_lines: .. _openstack_flavor_list: openstack flavor list usage: openstack flavor list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,json,table,value,yaml,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--public | --private | --all] [--long] [--marker <marker>] [--limit <limit>]

subject: Add cookiecutter_repo to OpenStack-Ansible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-28 14:21:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/3add32ea6baf3a6d7e63d45d1633cc897bf6d3b8', 'message': 'Add cookiecutter_repo to OpenStack-Ansible

This patch adds a new preseeded git repository to OpenStack-Ansible

commit_message:
Add cookiecutter_repo to OpenStack-Ansible

This patch adds a new preseeded git repository to OpenStack-Ansible
for a cookiecutter repository that can be used when implementing
new OpenStack-Ansible roles or repositories.

The role consists of a base set of tests/doc/task and general
infrastructure files.

Change-Id: Ief8553c8deb90a89e4d1d2dc5f7d8c3015af223d

Port libvirt test_imagecache to Python 3

* hashlib.sha1 changes its property digestsize to digest_size
  in Python 3

* encode unicode string before hashing in Python 3

Partially-Implements: blueprint goal-python35

added_lines: """Returns the UUIDs of Ironic nodes managed by this compute service. We use consistent hashing to distribute Ironic nodes between all available compute services. The subset of nodes managed by a given compute service is determined by the following rules: * any node with an instance managed by the compute service * any node that is mapped to the compute service on the hash ring * no nodes with instances managed by another compute service The ring is rebalanced as nova-compute services are brought up and down. Note that this rebalance does not happen at the same time for all compute services, so a node may be managed by multiple compute services for a small amount of time.
deleted_lines: """Returns the UUIDs of all nodes in the Ironic inventory.

commit_message:
Consider deprecating isolated_images

isolated_images et cetera feels very much like a special case of a
host aggregate to me. I'd like to make sure we make a note to
consider if we could deprecate this in favor of something more
generic.

Blueprint centralize-config-options-ocata
Change-Id: I0cdfbc58a330f92ee47c05cd83a17735d2a49ad8

commit_message:
[UG] Add description of `delete graph` command

This patch:

- adds the description of the `fuel2 delete graph` command
  to the corresponding sub-section of Fuel CLI section;
- adds steps on how to delete a deployment workflow
  to the Manage workflows sub-section of the Maintain your
  env section;
- changes the following parameters as preferable in
  fuel2 CLI where applicable: '--env' to '-e',
  '--type' to '-t', '--release' to '-r', '--plugin' to '-p',
  '--all' to '-a', '--cluster' to 'c';
- renames 'graph' to 'workflow';
- fixes noticed typos.
- removes a space in describe-plugin.rst that breaks
  Fuel CI (see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/397050
  patch in master branch that was reverted but used
  to create Newton branch).

Change-Id: I2e88436792d812ba60f5189c4a572d680ed0ae21
Closes-Bug: #1633773
(cherry picked from commit 51ac33c003e683bd169191410408b8a2f0c56985)

commit_message:
collect-logs: add timeout to log uploads

Uploading the logs can take too much time, resulting ssh connection
timeout during the ansible task execution. Log collection usually runs
in post build tasks, making it immune to jenkins job timeouts.

This change makes the upload tasks asyncronous and adds a timeout.

Change-Id: I65cf017717775ac85b953fe554f84c79e4f808b5

Added releasenote for retry policy update

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/383617/ updates the retry policy
and is a huge change for some of the workflows. Hence, adding a
releasenote.

commit_message:
Remove support for single backend config

It was not recommended for some releases, deprecated in Newton, so let's
remove it in Ocata.

Change-Id: If7e76ad904179a89ca98eb81ebe40e0243245672
Related-Bug: 1630975

commit_message:
std.email action requires a smtp_password

When attempting to run a workbook with an email action (std.email)
you have to specify a value for smtp_password.This patch attempts
to fix this bug.

Change-Id: I60f30e306ba673a1015e4bfb156ce282ed98406a
Closes-Bug: #1639682

commit_message:
Remove the duplicate calls to rescan

This patch removes the initial call to _rescan_iscsi() prior to calling
get_potential_volume_paths, because _rescan_iscsi is called inside.

Change-Id: I9e668efaf5995e6bcef994d7cfa765546648cf8e

commit_message:
Added retries for db_sync

If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: I094f592989928cefef0b9cd9c7b9d837f51d03b1
Related-Bug: #1628580
Closes-Bug: #1645474
(cherry picked from commit 5e3b5e050fa2b9377792852aabba8487abb7099e)

commit_message:
Change version '1.0' to '2.0'

In the file :"mistral/mistral/workbook/v2/actions.py",a variable
named "_version" is initialized '1.0',because the default version
is '2.0',so I change it to '2.0'

commit_message:
Factorize load balancer code into its own template

Heat types moved to lb.yaml:

Neutron::LBaaS::LoadBalancer
Neutron::LBaaS::Listener
Neutron::LBaaS::Pool
Neutron::LBaaS::HealthMonitor
FloatingIP on LBaaS

Closes-Bug: 1644454
Change-Id: I513b92c205ed97334033ba38ddf1d890ed61ff84

commit_message:
Filter workflow executions by creating task execution id

This will enable the mistral UI to go from task execution screen
to the workflow execution screen of the workflow execution created
by the task.

Change-Id: Ia2ac765a26acc8dcd27134f5f467cddef03fea95
Implements: blueprint filter-workflow-executions-by-creating-task-id

commit_message:
Enable TLS in the internal network for glance API and registry

This optionally enables TLS for glance's different services  in the
internal network. If internal TLS is enabled, each node that is
serving the keystone service will use certmonger to request its
certificate.

bp tls-via-certmonger
Change-Id: I1b256291ed2cc521e037d7ab8cf1e9cfb48d5d33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/73/327473/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*tls_certfile*] # (Optional) The path to the certificate that will be used for TLS in this # service. # Defaults to '/etc/pki/tls/certs/glance-api.crt' # # [*tls_keyfile*] # (Optional) The path to the key that will be used for TLS in this service. # Defaults to '/etc/pki/tls/private/glance-api.key' # # [*service_principal*] # (Optional) The kerberos service principal that will be used to request the # certificate. (Might not be needed depending on the CA). # Defaults to "glance-api/${::fqdn}" # # [*tls_cert_refresh_command*] # (Optional) The command that will be issued after certmonger issues a # resubmit for the certificate. That is, when the certificate expires and a # new one needs to be requested. This typically needs to be a command that # can refresh the service so it can start using the new certificate. # Defaults to (TBD) # # TLS $tls_certfile = '/etc/pki/tls/certs/glance-api.crt', $tls_keyfile = '/etc/pki/tls/private/glance-api.key', $service_principal = "glance-api/${::fqdn}", $tls_cert_refresh_command = '/bin/true', $enable_internal_tls = hiera('enable_internal_tls', false) if $enable_internal_tls { include ::tripleo::internal_tls certmonger_certificate { 'glance-api-cert': certfile => $tls_certfile, keyfile => $tls_keyfile, hostname => $::fqdn, principal => $service_principal, postsave_cmd => $tls_cert_refresh_command, notify => Service[$::glance::params::api_service_name], } Glance::Api { cert_file => $tls_certfile, key_file => tls_keyfile, } }

commit_message:
Fix can't generate heka-custom.toml on multi-nodes

Original we judge heka-custom.toml whether exists with stat: path=
method, but if deploy on multi-nodes, should add local_action.

Change-Id: Id56f358718ef65ebd311d0c1876e5ab1ba5bda10
Closes-Bug: #1646732
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/27/408527/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local_action: stat path="{{ node_custom_config }}/heka/heka-custom.toml"

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/39340393de6aa7f79361f42c47828634

Change-Id: Ib3381a187bfd8b2d1eef352471530d12584bc4f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-ops-database refs/changes/58/403358/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Validate minimum RAM for snapshot source

On launch instance there was no check for
min RAM values when launching from snapshot.
Now when launching from snapshot it will check
the same requirements as the images.

Change-Id: I138476b839319f357022f9545c5104a17a382df3
Partial-Bug: #1401101
(cherry picked from commit ce8677e675ce1e7462dc941caacbd8d961104a0e)

commit_message:
Fix duplicate declaration

User configures Username(root) and Home directory(/root) in
Operating System Access, and will throw the error that
Credentials_file[/root/openrc] is already declared in deployment.

Change-Id: I6f437550edd78af372e5f52b55663beab86edfee
Closes-Bug: #1636472
(cherry picked from commit 12769a9127b438c324a2c4189a7db61aa3f958d2)

added_lines: module Puppet::Parser::Functions newfunction(:get_cred_files_hash, :type => :rvalue, :arity => 3, :doc => <<-EOS Build hash for credentials files creation EOS ) do |args| raise(Puppet::ParseError, 'Wrong cred_users. Should be a Hash.') unless args[0].is_a?(Hash) raise(Puppet::ParseError, 'Wrong common_cred_params. Should be a Hash.') unless args[1].is_a?(Hash) raise(Puppet::ParseError, 'Wrong users. Should be a Hash.') unless args[2].is_a?(Hash) cred_users, common_cred_params, users = args cred_users.inject({}) do |result, el| home_dir, owner = el.first, el.last if users.has_key?(owner) result[home_dir] = common_cred_params.dup.update({'owner' => owner, 'group' => owner, 'require' => "User[#{users[owner]}]"}) else result[home_dir] = common_cred_params.dup.update({'owner' => owner, 'group' => owner}) end result end end end

commit_message:
mistral-dashboard:fixed boolean field design bug

* boolean field design - removed the false check from detail screens,
  it is actually a bug: false is a valid value - and has a matching
  design.

Change-Id: Ifbec1757026f69abe6035ca35d0275c534e09b71

subject: [WIP] Handle unserializable objects returned by custom actions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 14:54:00.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_error_result.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/180e99472fcd707ef0f530cf5aba467595ec5454', 'message': '[WIP] Handle unserializable objects returned by custom actions

TODO:
- Write the fix.
- Write a test specific to serialization

This patch adds a test to demonstrate the problem. Workflows will get
stuck in the "RUNNING" state. I think the problem is in the
serialization, but some investigation is needed.

Change-Id: Ib4e1e5f1a5fcd549ef0c7414e1ef6173f280f3f3
Closes-Bug: #1645295
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Handle unserializable objects returned by custom actions

TODO:
- Write the fix.
- Write a test specific to serialization

This patch adds a test to demonstrate the problem. Workflows will get
stuck in the "RUNNING" state. I think the problem is in the
serialization, but some investigation is needed.

Change-Id: Ib4e1e5f1a5fcd549ef0c7414e1ef6173f280f3f3
Closes-Bug: #1645295
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/05/407005/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: WF2 = """ --- version: '2.0' exception_workflow: tasks: exception_task: action: exception_action """ class ExceptionAction(actions_base.Action): def __init__(self): pass def run(self): return wf_utils.Result(error=Exception) test_base.register_action_class('exception_action', ExceptionAction) def test_exception_action(self): wf_service.create_workflows(WF2) wf_ex = self.engine.start_workflow("exception_workflow", {}) self.await_workflow_error(wf_ex.id) with db_api.transaction(): wf_ex = db_api.get_workflow_execution(wf_ex.id) tasks = wf_ex.task_executions self.assertEqual(1, len(tasks)) task1 = self._assert_single_item(tasks, name='exception_task') self.assertEqual(states.ERROR, task1.state)

subject: Remove additional response.render() for tabs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 13:11:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/5b24385af0d12662ca0de59ee36d2374b26ae8eb', 'message': 'Remove additional response.render() for tabs

Right now TabbedView has additional .render()
call. Thus get_context_data() for TabbedView
returns already rendered response with
rendered=True flag, which makes it read-only.
This block middleware to modify response.
For example, we cannot add any messages to
response from tabbed view.

Simple views has no additional rendering.
It was done because of issues wth
raising redirect exceptions from
tabbed views long ago. Looks like now
there is no such issues and raising redirects
from tabbed views is covered with unit tests.

Change-Id: I37076abc15008a523f37da0d09b5b041ef77844e
Closes-Bug: #1595095
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-11 13:17:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/bced20fb8bb73aee7fecd9d2984c7a25d912122e', 'message': 'Remove additional response.render() for tabs

Right now TabbedView has additional .render() call. Thus
get_context_data() for TabbedView returns already rendered response
with rendered=True flag, which makes it read-only.  This blocks
Profiler middleware in modifying the response. For example, we cannot
add any messages to response from tabbed view.

Simple views have no additional rendering. It was done because of
issues with raising redirect exceptions from tabbed views long
ago. Looks like now there is no such issues and raising redirects from
tabbed views is covered with unit tests.

a test with a tab raising Http302 was added - it still redirects to
the url provided as before.

Change-Id: I37076abc15008a523f37da0d09b5b041ef77844e
Closes-Bug: #1595095

commit_message:
Remove additional response.render() for tabs

Right now TabbedView has additional .render() call. Thus
get_context_data() for TabbedView returns already rendered response
with rendered=True flag, which makes it read-only.  This blocks
Profiler middleware in modifying the response. For example, we cannot
add any messages to response from tabbed view.

Simple views have no additional rendering. It was done because of
issues with raising redirect exceptions from tabbed views long
ago. Looks like now there is no such issues and raising redirects from
tabbed views is covered with unit tests. To ensure that nothing broke,
a test with a tab raising Http302 was added - it still redirects to
the url provided as before.

Change-Id: I37076abc15008a523f37da0d09b5b041ef77844e
Closes-Bug: #1595095
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/45/333345/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Because Django's TemplateView uses the TemplateResponse class # to provide deferred rendering (which is usually helpful), if # a tab group raises an Http302 redirect (from exceptions.handle for # example) the exception is actually raised *after* the final pass # of the exception-handling middleware. response.render()

commit_message:
Add Try/Exception block to Networks Table

Add try except around is_extension_supported api call.
Changed the properties so if the api call results in error
the table columns are deleted.

(cherry picked from commit aa005fe7c8c36e54750f4624eb1a996234b8698c)

commit_message:
Add constraints support to run_tests.sh

Currently developers need to manually build a constratined venv if they
want to  match the versions that are tested in the gate.  This change
adds logic to run_tests.sh and install_venv*.py to default to the same
constraints file used in the gate.

With constraints enabled the 'churn' in the environment should be
minimised so remove the developer optimisation for detecting when
packaged versions change and always just install/update.  This has the
down side of making the script preamble slightly longer but we always
print_help() so I don't think it'll be terribly inconvenient.

Change-Id: I9bf85adb5aa2c85d8c0f0f22ac9efe5cac3646c0
Closes-Bug: 1644697
(cherry picked from commit a909ed26c2aa6daf2c5fc59a2f575a66cdddbfb5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/12/403812/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: constraints = os.environ.get('UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE') py_version, project, constraints=constraints)

commit_message:
Added docker image tag parameter in kolla-ansible

Docker image tag can be specified in the globals.yml, but add
supporting in the kolla-ansible will make kolla more flexible,
expecially, when using the kolla-ansible to deploy with Jenkins,
and the Jenkins will generate the docker tag automatically

Change-Id: I9b8c3325d63f022a2cd13152f06f7dc52d66ab09
Closes-Bug: #1646722

The design summit took place in Boston, Massachusetts, US and " "Essex is a nearby city." msgstr "" "Групповой релиз относящихся к OpenStack проектов, состоявшийся в апреле 2012 " "года (пятый релиз OpenStack). Включает службу вычислительных ресурсов (Nova " "2012.1), объектное хранилище (Swift 1.4.8), службу образов (Glance), службу " "идентификации (Keystone) и панель управления (Horizon). Essex — кодовое имя " "пятого релиза OpenStack. Folsom is the code name for " "the sixth release of OpenStack. Включает службу вычислительных ресурсов " "(Nova), объектное хранилище (Swift), службу идентификации (Keystone), службу " "сети (Neutron) , службу Image (Glance), а также службу томов или блочное " "хранилище (Cinder) . Folsom — кодовое имя шестого релиза OpenStack. Саммит " "разработчиков проходил в Сан-Франциско, Калифорния, США (Фолсом — название " "близлежащего города)." #, fuzzy msgid "" "A list of URL and port number endpoints that indicate where a service, such " "as Object Storage, Compute, Identity, and so on, can be accessed." msgstr "" "Перечень URL-адресов и номеров портов точек входа, в котором указано, как " "можно получить доступ к службе, например к службе объектного хранилища, " "вычислительных ресурсов, идентификации и т.д." #, fuzzy msgid "" "A method to establish trusts between identity providers and the OpenStack " "cloud." msgstr "" "Метод установки доверительных отношений между провайдерами идентификации и " "облаком OpenStack." msgid "A network segment typically used for instance Internet access." msgstr "" "Сетевой сегмент, как правило, используемый для быстрого доступа к Интернету." msgid "A routing algorithm in the Compute RabbitMQ." msgstr "Алгоритм маршрутизации для вычислительных ресурсов Compute RabbitMQ." msgid "Alternative term for a RabbitMQ message exchange." msgstr "Альтернативный термин для обмена сообщениями RabbitMQ." msgid "Alternative term for a VM instance type." msgstr "Альтернативный термин для типа инстанса виртуальной машины." msgid "" "Alternative term for an API extension or plug-in. In the context of Identity " "service, this is a call that is specific to the implementation, such as " "adding support for OpenID." msgstr "" "Альтернативный термин для расширения или модуля API. В контексте службы " "идентификации это вызов, соответствующий реализации, например добавление " "поддержки OpenID." #, fuzzy msgid "Alternative term for an Identity service catalog." msgstr "Альтернативный термин для каталога службы идентификации (Identity)." #, fuzzy msgid "" "An Amazon EBS storage volume that contains a bootable VM image, currently " "unsupported in OpenStack." msgstr "" "Том устройства хранения Amazon EBS, в котором содержится загрузочный образ " "ВМ. В настоящий момент не поддерживается в OpenStack." "An IP address that a project can associate with a VM so that the instance " "has the same public IP address each time that it boots. You create a pool of " "floating IP addresses and assign them to instances as they are launched to " "maintain a consistent IP address for maintaining DNS assignment." msgstr "" "IP-адрес, назначаемый проектом виртуальной машине таким образом, чтобы " "инстанс получал один и тот же общедоступный IP-адрес при каждой загрузке. " "Можно создать пул плавающих IP-адресов и назначать их инстансам при запуске, " "чтобы поддерживать постоянство IP-адреса и сохранять назначенные DNS-имена." msgid "" "An IP address that is associated with the same instance each time that " "instance boots, is generally not accessible to end users or the public " "Internet, and is used for management of the instance." msgstr "" "IP-адрес, связываемый с одним и тем же инстансом при каждой загрузке, как " "правило, недоступный для конечных пользователей Интернета и используемый для " "управления инстансом." msgid """An easy method to create a local LDAP directory for testing Identity and " "Compute. Requires Redis." msgstr "" "Удобный метод создания локального каталога LDAP для тестирования службы " "идентификации и вычислительных ресурсов. Требования: Redis." msgid ""#, fuzzy msgid "" "Any piece of hardware or software that wants to connect to the network " "services provided by Networking, the network connectivity service. An entity " "can make use of Networking by implementing a VIF." msgstr "" "Любая часть аппаратного или программного обеспечения, которой требуется " "подключение к сетевым службам, предоставляемым службой Networking. Для " "использования сущностью возможностей Networking, можно создать VIF." msgid "" "Connected to by a direct consumer in RabbitMQ—Compute, the message can be " "consumed only by the current connection." msgstr "" "В RabbitMQ используется для подключения непосредственного потребителя — " "службы Compute. К сообщениям такой очереди доступ имеет только текущее " "соединение. " #, fuzzy#, fuzzy msgid "EBS boot volume" msgstr "Загрузочный том EBS" #, fuzzy msgid "EC2 Compatibility API" msgstr "EC2 Compatibility API" #, fuzzy msgid "EC2 access key" msgstr "Ключ доступа к EC2" #, fuzzy msgid "EC2 secret key" msgstr "секретный ключ EC2" #, fuzzy msgid "Elastic Block Storage (EBS)" msgstr "Elastic Block Storage (EBS)" #, fuzzy msgid "F" msgstr "Ф" msgid "Fibre Channel" msgstr "Fibre Channel" msgid "" "File system option that enables storage of additional information beyond " "owner, group, permissions, modification time, and so on. The underlying " "Object Storage file system must support extended attributes." msgstr "" "Параметр файловой системы, благодаря которому можно хранить дополнительную " "информацию помимо владельца, группы, разрешений, времени изменения и " "прочего. Базовая файловая система объектного хранилища должна поддерживать " "дополнительные атрибуты." #, fuzzy msgid "" "Filtering tool for a Linux bridging firewall, enabling filtering of network " "traffic passing through a Linux bridge. Used in Compute along with " "arptables, iptables, and ip6tables to ensure isolation of network " "communications." msgstr "" "Инструмент фильтрации сетевого трафика для брандмауэров на программных " "мостах Linux. Используется в вычислительной службе совместно с arptables, " "iptables и ip6tables для обеспечения изоляции сетевых коммуникаций." msgid "FireWall-as-a-Service (FWaaS)" msgstr "FireWall-as-a-Service (FWaaS)" #, fuzzy msgid "Flat Manager" msgstr "Диспетчер одноуровневой сети" msgid "FlatDHCP Manager" msgstr "FlatDHCP Manager" msgid "" "MD5 hash of an object within Object Storage, used to ensure data integrity." msgstr "" "Хэш md5 объекта в объектном хранилище, который используется для контроля " "целостности данных." #, fuzzymsgid "" "Object Storage middleware that uploads (posts) an image through a form on a " "web page." msgstr "" "Промежуточное ПО объектного хранилища, передающее (публикующее) изображение " "с помощью формы на веб-странице." "OpenStack project that provides backup restore and disaster recovery as a " "service." msgstr "" "Проект OpenStack, предлагающий резервное копирование и аварийное " "восстановление в виде услуги." msgid ""msgid "OpenStack supports accessing the Amazon EC2 API through Compute." msgstr "" "OpenStack поддерживает доступ к интерфейсу Amazon EC2 API через службу " "вычислительных ресурсов (Compute)." #, fuzzy msgid "" "OpenStack supports encryption technologies such as HTTPS, SSH, SSL, TLS, " "digital certificates, and data encryption." msgstr "" "В OpenStack поддерживаются следующие технологии шифрования: HTTPS, SSH, SSL, " "TLS, цифровые сертификаты и шифрование данных." #, fuzzymsgid "See API endpoint." msgstr "См. точка входа API." #, fuzzymsgid "" "Specifies additional requirements when Compute determines where to start a " "new instance. Examples include a minimum amount of network bandwidth or a " "GPU." msgstr "" "Указывает дополнительные требования, используемые службой Compute при " "определении того, где создать новый инстанс. Например, можно задать " "минимальную пропускную способность сети или графический процессор (GPU)." #, fuzzymsgid "" "Storage protocol similar in concept to TCP/IP; encapsulates SCSI commands " "and data." msgstr "" "Протокол хранения данных, сходный с TCP/IP; позволяет инкапсулировать " "команды и данные SCSI." #, fuzzy msgid "The Amazon commercial block storage product." msgstr "" "Коммерческий продукт компании Amazon для использования виртуальных блочных " "устройств." #, fuzzy msgid "The Amazon commercial compute product, similar to Compute." msgstr "" "Коммерческий продукт Amazon — служба по предоставлению вычислительных " "ресурсов, подобная службе Compute." #, fuzzy msgid "" "The Compute component that gives IP addresses to authorized nodes and " "assumes DHCP, DNS, and routing configuration and services are provided by " "something else." msgstr "" "Компонент службы вычислительных ресурсов (Compute), который назначает IP-" "адреса авторизованным узлам. Предполагается, что службы и настройки DHCP, " "DNS и маршрутизации уже предоставлены." #, fuzzy msgid "" "The Compute component that provides dnsmasq (DHCP, DNS, BOOTP, TFTP) and " "radvd (routing) services." msgstr "" "Компонент службы вычислительных ресурсов (Compute), который предоставляет " "службы dnsmasq (DHCP, DNS, BOOTP, TFTP) и radvd (маршрутизация)." #, fuzzy msgid "" "The Compute scheduling method that attempts to fill a host with VMs rather " "than starting new VMs on a variety of hosts." msgstr "" "Используемый Compute метод выбора одного хоста для размещения ВМ вплоть его " "заполнения (в отличие от запуска новых виртуальных машин на разных хостах). " #, fuzzy msgid "The fibre channel protocol tunneled within Ethernet." msgstr "Протокол Fibre Channel поверх протокола Ethernet." #, fuzzy msgid "" "The practice of placing one packet type within another for the purposes of " "abstracting or securing data. Examples include GRE, MPLS, or IPsec." msgstr "" "Метод размещения пакетов одного типа в пакетах другого типа в целях " "абстрагирования или обеспечения безопасности данных. Примеры: GRE, MPLS и " "IPsec." #, fuzzy msgid "" "The process of migrating one or all virtual machine (VM) instances from one " "host to another, compatible with both shared storage live migration and " "block migration." msgstr "" "Процесс миграции одного или всех инстансов виртуальных машин (ВМ) с одного " "хоста на другой, совместимый с живой миграцией общего хранилища и блочной " "миграцией." "The step in the Compute scheduling process when hosts that cannot run VMs " "are eliminated and not chosen." msgstr "" "Шаг планирования в службе вычислительных ресурсов, при котором хосты, не " "запустившие виртуальные машины, удаляются без выбора." msgid ""#, fuzzy msgid "UUID for each Compute or Image service VM flavor or instance type." msgstr "" "UUID для каждого типа инстанса виртуальной машины в службе вычислительных " "ресурсов или образов." #, fuzzy msgid "" "Used along with an EC2 access key when communicating with the Compute EC2 " "API; used to digitally sign each request." msgstr "" "Используется совместно с ключом доступа к EC2 при взаимодействии с Compute " "EC2 API. Позволяет добавлять цифровую подпись в каждый запрос." #, fuzzy msgid "Used along with an EC2 secret key to access the Compute EC2 API." msgstr "" "Используется совместно с секретным ключом EC2 для доступа к EC2 API службы " "вычислительных ресурсов." msgid "Used along with an EKI to create an EMI." msgstr "Используется наряду с EKI, чтобы создать EMI." msgid "Used along with an ERI to create an EMI." msgstr "Используется наряду с ERI, чтобы создать EMI." msgid "" "Used to restrict communications between hosts and/or nodes, implemented in " "Compute using iptables, arptables, ip6tables, and ebtables." msgstr "" "Используется для ограничения соединений между хостами и узлами. Реализуется " "в службе Compute с помощью iptables, arptables, ip6tables и ebtables." #, fuzzymsgid "VM image container format supported by Image service." msgstr "" "Формат контейнера виртуальной машины, поддерживаемый службой образов (Image)." #, fuzzy#, fuzzy msgid "" "Virtual network type that uses neither VLANs nor tunnels to segregate " "project traffic. Each flat network typically requires a separate underlying " "physical interface defined by bridge mappings. However, a flat network can " "contain multiple subnets." msgstr "" "Тип виртуальной сети, в которой не используются ни VLAN, ни туннели для " "разделения трафика проекта. Как правило, для каждой одноуровневой сети " "требуется отдельный физический интерфейс, реализованный с помощью моста. " "Однако одноуровневая сеть может состоять из нескольких подсетей." #, fuzzy msgid "" "Volume that does not save the changes made to it and reverts to its original " "state when the current user relinquishes control." msgstr "" "Том, который не сохраняет внесенные изменения и возвращается в исходное " "состояние, когда текущий пользователь отказывается от его управлением." msgid "" "Within RabbitMQ and Compute, it is the messaging interface that is used by " "the scheduler service to receive capability messages from the compute, " "volume, and network nodes." msgstr "" "Интерфейс обмена сообщениями в RabbitMQ и Compute, который используется " "службой планировщика для получения сообщений о состоянии от вычислительных и " "сетевых узлов, а также томов." #, fuzzymsgid "encapsulation" msgstr "инкапсуляция" #, fuzzy msgid "encryption" msgstr "шифрование" #, fuzzy msgid "endpoint" msgstr "точка входа" #, fuzzy msgid "endpoint registry" msgstr "реестр точек входа" #, fuzzy msgid "endpoint template" msgstr "шаблон точки входа" msgid "entity" msgstr "сущность" msgid "ephemeral image" msgstr "эфемерный образ" #, fuzzy msgid "ephemeral volume" msgstr "эфемерный том" msgid "evacuate" msgstr "эвакуация" msgid "exchange" msgstr "обмен" msgid "exchange type" msgstr "тип обмена" msgid "exclusive queue" msgstr "эксклюзивная очередь" msgid "extended attributes (xattr)" msgstr "расширенные атрибуты (xattr)" msgid "extension" msgstr "расширение" msgid "external network" msgstr "внешняя сеть" msgid "extra specs" msgstr "Доп. параметры" #, fuzzy msgid "fan-out exchange" msgstr "обмен типа fan-out" msgid "federated identity" msgstr "федеративное удостоверение" #, fuzzy msgid "fill-first scheduler" msgstr "планировщик выбора первого хоста" msgid "filter" msgstr "фильтр" msgstr "Брандмауэр" msgid "fixed IP address" msgstr "фиксированный IP-адрес" #, fuzzy msgid "flat mode injection" msgstr "внедрение одноуровневого режима" #, fuzzy msgid "flat network" msgstr "одноуровневая сеть" msgid "flavor" msgstr "Тип инстанса" msgid "flavor ID" msgstr "ID типа инстанса" msgid "floating IP address" msgstr "плавающий IP-адрес" msgid "freezer" msgstr "freezer"

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-12-07 09:55+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-12-07 10:02+0000\n"msgstr "" "La sortie réelle peut être légèrement différente que celle de cet exemple. "msgstr "Ajouter le rôle ``admin`` à l'utilisateur ``neutron`` :"msgstr "Ajouter le rôle ``admin`` à l'utilisateur ``nova`` :""fournisseur (externe) connecté à l'infrastructure de réseau physique via le " "layer-2 (bridging/switching). Ce réseau inclut un serveur DHCP qui fournit ""créer une base de données, des crédentiels de service et des endpoints API.""Avant d'installer et configurer le service Compute, vous devez créer les " "bases de données, les crédentiels de service et les endpoints API.""firewall Compute en utilisant le driver firewall ``nova.virt.firewall."msgstr "Créer les endpoints API pour le service Réseau :"msgstr "Créer la base de données ``neutron`` :"msgstr "Créer l'entité de service ``neutron`` :"msgstr "Créer l'utilisateur ``neutron`` :"msgstr "Créer les bases de données ``nova_api`` et ``nova`` :"msgstr "Créer l'utilisateur ``nova`` :""La population de la base de données a lieu plus tard pour le service Réseau " "car le script a besoin des fichiers de configuration complets pour le " "serveur et les plugins.""Déterminer si les nœuds compute supportent l'accélération matérielle pour " "les machines virtuelles :""Editer le fichier ``/etc/neutron/dhcp_agent.ini`` et effectuer les actions " "suivantes :""Editer le fichier ``/etc/neutron/l3_agent.ini`` et effectuer les actions " "suivantes :""actions suivantes :""actions suivantes :""Éditer le fichier ``/etc/nova/nova.conf`` et effectuer les actions " "suivantes :"msgstr "Pour les deux options Réseau :""Pour plus d'informations sur le service Réseau et les composants de réseau " "virtuel, la configuration et les flux, voir le `Guide de Réseau <http://docs." "openstack.org/mitaka/networking-guide/>`__.""Pour le Réseau option 2, activer également et démarrer le service layer-3 :""Pour le Réseau option 2, installer égalemnt le package ``neutron-l3-agent``."msgstr "Pour le Réseau option 2, redémarrer également le service layer-3 :""Attribuer les droits d'accès nécessaires à la base de données ``neutron``, " "en remplaçant ``NEUTRON_DBPASS`` par un mot de passe approprié :"msgstr "Octroyer les droits d'accès nécessaires aux bases de données :""votre contrôleur. ""Si la commande retourne une valeur ``supérieure ou égale à un``, votre nœud " "compute supporte l'accélération matérielle ce qui ne nécessite en général " "aucune configuration complémentaire.""Si la commande retourne la valeur ``zéro``, votre nœud compute ne supporte ""services réseau layer-3 :""l'accès à la file de messages ``RabbitMQ`` :""postinst du package ``nova-common`` à l'aide de debconf) :""et le bridge du réseau externe :""bridge, le driver DHCP Dnsmasq et activer les metadata isolées pour que les ""travers le réseau :""partagé :"msgstr "Dans la section ``[DEFAULT]``, activer le support du service Réseau :""désactiver les plugins additionnels :""service routeur et le chevauchement d'adresses IP :""d'Image :"msgstr "Dans la section ``[ml2]``, désactiver les réseaux libre-service :"msgstr "Dans la section ``[ml2]``, activer les réseaux libre-service VXLAN :"msgstr "Dans la section ``[ml2]``, activer les réseaux flat et VLAN :"msgstr "Dans la section ``[ml2]``, activer les réseaux flat, VLAN et VXLAN :""Dans la section ``[ml2]``, activer Linux bridge et les mécanismes de layer-2 " "population :"msgstr "Dans la section ``[ml2]``, activer le mécanisme Linux bridge :""ports :""fournisseur comme étant un réseau à plat :""réseau VXLAN pour les réseaux libre-services :""proxy metadata et configurer le secret :""l'efficacité des règles des groupes de sécurité :""Dans la section ``[vnc]``, activer et configurer l'accès distant à la " "console :""de recouvrement et activer le layer-2 population :"msgstr "" "Lister les agents pour vérifier que les agents neutron sont bien lancés :""Lister les extensions chargées pour vérifier que le processus ``neutron-" "server``a bien démarré :""uniquement les instances directement attachées aux réseaux fournisseur " "(externes). Pas de réseaux libre-service (privés), pas routeurs, pas " "adresses IP flottantes. Seul l'utilisateur ``admin`` ou tout autre " "utilisateur à privilèges peut gérer les réseaux fournisseurs.""fournisseur.""L'option 2 ajoute à l'option 1 des services layer-3 qui supporte " "l'attachement des instances à des réseaux libre-service. L'utilisateur ""libre-service incluant les routeurs qui fournissent la connectivité entre " "les réseaux libre-service et les réseaux fournisseur. De plus, des adresses " "IP flottantes fournissent la connectivité aux instances des réseaux libre-" "service à partir de réseaux externes comme Internet."msgstr "Peupler la base de données :""réseau physique sous-jacente qui gère les réseaux de recouvrement. " "L'architecture en exemple utilise l'interface de management pour tunneliser " "le trafic vers les autres nœuds. Par conséquent, remplacer " "``OVERLAY_INTERFACE_IP_ADDRESS`` par l'adresse IP de management du " "contrôleur. Voir :ref:`environment-networking`pour plus d'informations.""installe les dépendances nécessaires :"msgstr "Redémarrer les services Réseau :""Retourner à :ref:`Configuration du Réseau sur le contrôleur <neutron-""Les réseaux libre-service utilisent en général les réseaux de recouvrement. " "Les protocoles de réseaux de recouvrement comme VXLAN incluent des entêtes " "supplémentaires qui augmentent le poids et diminuent l'espace disponible " "pour la charge utile ou les données utilisateur. Sans connaissance de ""défaut de 1500 octets. Le service Réseau fournit automatiquement la valeur " "de MTU correcte aux instances via le DHCP. Cependant, certaines images cloud " "n'utilisent pas le DHCP ou ignorent l'option MTU du DHCP et nécessitent une " "configuration en utilisant les metadata ou un script.""pour se lancer au démarrage du système :""du système :""réseaux virtuels libre-service.""L':term:`agent metadata <Metadata agent>` fournit aux instances les " "informations de configuration comme les crédentiels.""L'agent Linux bridge construit l'infrastructure de réseau virtuel layer-2 " "(bridging and switching) pour les instances et gère les groupes de sécurité.""L'agent Linux bridge supporte uniquement les réseaux de recouvrement VXLAN.""l'infrastructure réseau virtuel layer-2 (bridging and switching) pour les " "instances.""La configuration du composant serveur du service Réseau inclut la base de " "données, le mécanisme d'authentification, la file de messages, les " "notifications de changement de topologie et les plugins.""ce lien symbolique n'existe pas, le créer à l'aide de la commande suivante :""La sortie d'écran doit indiquer quatre agents sur le contrôleur et un agent " "sur chaque nœud compute.""La sortie d'écran doit indiquer trois agents sur le contrôleur et un agent " "sur chaque nœud compute.""navigateur web pour accéder aux consoles distantes des instances de ce nœud ""(neutron) en utilisant l'option :ref:`réseaux fournisseur <network1>` ou " "l'option :ref:`réseaux libre-service <network2>`. ""example-architectures>`. Chaque nœud compute supplémentaire nécessite une " "adresse IP unique.""l'accélération matérielle pour les machines virtuelles. Sur du matériel " "traditionnel, cette configuration utilise l'hyperviseur générique QEMU. Vous " "pouvez aussi suivre ces instructions, à peu de choses près, pour mettre à " "l'échelle horizontalement votre environnement en ajoutant des nœuds compute.""nom de code nova, sur le contrôleur. "msgstr "Pour créer les bases de données, dérouler ces étapes :""Utiliser la section vérification pour l'option Réseau que vous avez choisie " "de déployer.""nécessaires au lancement d'une instance de base. Vous pouvez :ref:`launch-"

subject: Reset flavors for other than "Boot from Image" source type.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-09 13:39:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/1bb5db1daef3dc686888bac78f5ec1984636824f', 'message': 'Reset flavors for other than "Boot from Image" source type.

If a launched instance from "Boot from image" source type is not
meeting the given image RAM/disk requirements, the "Flavor" field
of Launch Instance will dispaly the below message.

"Some flavors not meeting minimum image requirements have been
disabled."

And the flavors that are not meeting the specified requirements
will be disabled under "Flavor" field.

After this message has been shown if we try to choose a source
type other than "Boot from image", the flavors are still in
disabled mode and message also not being cleared.

To fix this issue resetFlavor() has been called to reset the
flavors when the source type is changed from "Boot from image"
to other source type. And disableFlavorsForImage() has been
called to disable the flavors that are not meeting the minimum
RAM/disk requirements when switched from other source type to
"Boot from image".

Change-Id: I1a105eb84bd5d92ad521d9a8ae290912d48cf275
Closes-Bug: #1482507
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-09 12:23:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/e3fd9bbb27ebdc15dc13cb42dcf75c25dec12339', 'message': 'Reset flavors for other than "Boot from Image" source type.

disabled mode and message also not being cleared.

To fix this issue resetFlavor() has been called to reset the
flavors when the source type is changed from "Boot from image"
to other source type. And disableFlavorsForImage() has been
called to disable the flavors that are not meeting the minimum
RAM/disk requirements when switched from other source type to
"Boot from image".

Change-Id: I1a105eb84bd5d92ad521d9a8ae290912d48cf275
Closes-Bug: #1482507
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-05 11:31:11.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.instances.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/b1373e0438c19485f3b0223e93948b5d4519c7ae', 'message': 'Reset flavors for other than "Boot from Image" source type.

If a launched instance from "Boot from image" source type is not
meeting the given image RAM/disk requirements, the "Flavor" field
of Launch Instance will display the below message.

"Some flavors not meeting minimum image requirements have been
disabled."

And the flavors that are not meeting the specified requirements
will be disabled under "Flavor" field.

After this message has been shown if we try to choose a source
type other than "Boot from image", the flavors are still in
disabled mode and message also not being cleared.

To fix this issue, Set the image name to default when the source type
is changed from "Boot from image" to other source type.So that
disableFlavorsForImage() has been called on Image name change to
reset flavors.

Change-Id: I1a105eb84bd5d92ad521d9a8ae290912d48cf275
Closes-Bug: #1482507
'}]
commit_message:
Reset flavors for other than "Boot from Image" source type.

If a launched instance from "Boot from image" source type is not
meeting the given image RAM/disk requirements, the "Flavor" field
of Launch Instance will display the below message.

"Some flavors not meeting minimum image requirements have been
disabled."

And the flavors that are not meeting the specified requirements
will be disabled under "Flavor" field.

After this message has been shown if we try to choose a source
type other than "Boot from image", the flavors are still in
disabled mode and message also not being cleared.

To fix this issue, Set the image name to default when the source type
is changed from "Boot from image" to other source type.So that
disableFlavorsForImage() has been called on Image name change to
reset flavors.

Change-Id: I1a105eb84bd5d92ad521d9a8ae290912d48cf275
Closes-Bug: #1482507
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/58/221758/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /* As part of fixing bug #1482507, calling resetFlavors() to enable all flavors for other than "Boot from image" source type. And for "Boot from image" source type, calling disableFlavorsForImage() to disable flavors that do not meet it's minimum RAM or disk requirements. */ if (base_type != "image_id") { horizon.Quota.resetFlavors(); } else { horizon.Quota.disableFlavorsForImage(); }

commit_message:
Allow router panel to not break sidebar

This patch handles an exception that is raised when the network service
is not present.  When unhandled, this causes the sidebar to not exist.

Change-Id: Ic5a94b267158d17a145c64c75fd7bf88e98478fa
Closes-Bug: 1647766

commit_message:
Delete deprecated directory openstack/common

Directory openstack/common has been out of date,so we can delete it,
and we should also delete this directory in flake8 exclude list.

Change-Id: I98af8dd332807343730b81a7f2c8422b63e6c38d

commit_message:
Fix up non-cells-aware context managers in test_db_api

We recently converted all the db_api calls to use pick_context_manager
so that they will work with CellsV2. There were, however, still some
instances in test_db_api that did the old thing for testing low-level
bits. This cleans those up in preparation for cells patches to come.
Since we have to use the pick decorators, this converts several things
to use a decorated closure for that reason. No real functional change
though.

Change-Id: I21a2e5e534f6da22942c65196904aaf82f47c317

commit_message:
Run neutron vpnaas jobs on Xenial

This is part of the Trusty to Xenial transition. Will run jobs for
changes against branches >= newton on Xenial. Older branches continue to
run jobs on Trusty.

Change-Id: I93c6b3b332d4764f99367d894e395e738c4dd332

commit_message:
Convert networking-ovn to xenial

This project doesn't have branches older than newton so we just shift
ahead to Xenial across the board.

This has the added benefit of using default rules to only run grenade
against changes to branches > newton. We don't want grenade to run
against newton because there is nothing before newton to upgrade from.

Change-Id: I35253730e94c035ecac3604596dd6b5f9f605834

commit_message:
Clean up networking ofagent JJB/zuul config

During the Xenial transition work noticed that this project doesn't
actually get developed past stable/mitaka. This means we can remove all
of the xenial jobs from it and just have trusty jobs.

Change-Id: I7bcadb2e7e929a309d846752428df4dc2af75c93

commit_message:
Simplify networking-odl JJB defs

This was part of the Xenial transition work. In order to understand of
this project had completed the transition I had to remove unused jobs,
compress existing job defs, and move comments around to where they are
supposed to be located just to understand what was going on.

I think this is much easier to understand now so pushing it up.

Change-Id: I6d9d3d343282f3b22892da7304623c9cc1f7387e

commit_message:
Use Query.column_descriptions instead of private property

TimeStamp_db_mixin was using the private '_mapper_adapter_map'
property of sqlalchemy's Query object. Replace it with the public
access property.

Change-Id: I9798078a6c3c4540379d419fb1f16b56d6a4efa6

commit_message:
Add heat plugin to shade jobs

heat is not in normal devstack anymore, it's in the heat repo. That's
awesome- but our jobs didn't know that. How about let's re-enable it.

Change-Id: I6e8944a18a0d0c80cadc0bd62bb6cdb04c03aee6

Revert unintentional part of adding python 3.5 nv jobs

There was an accidental part in the previous review that shouldn't
have gone in yet as there is no docs target in monasca-agent. revert
that.

This reverts parts of commit a68dee6886980e9f94310c9b6ebd457ca9766ae1.

Convert murano jobs to Xenial

This converts murano jobs to run on Xenial as part of the transition
away from Trusty. Affects changes to branches >= newton. Older branches
continue running on Trusty.

Change-Id: Iad3d46f18cb5de68a0b3e2fc208358659a37b275

commit_message:
Migrate monasca-analytics unittests to Xenial

This change is a little tricky because we have to make sure we don't
conflict with the job defs in the python-jobs group. So we remove the
python-jobs group from this project, redefine the portions we want, then
sprinkle in the special sauce unittest job.

Changes to branches >= newton will now run this job on Xenial. Older
branches on Trusty.

Change-Id: I737ee23335fadff8e183c99c7e2e0389b900a7d5

commit_message:
Add powervm-ci group to *-powervm projects

This adds a new group to ceilometer-powervm, networking-powervm
and nova-powervm. This group can provide +/-1 Verified votes and
will be used for the IBM PowerVM CI user to provide Verified votes.

Change-Id: Ib958dc54694494cedda51b0e6708119a8d833afb

commit_message:
Refactor clients used in protect service

Refactor the way of creating client of other openstack service
used in protect service, which includes several respects.

1. Move several public config items into the common config list.
For example, move 'auth_insecure' to common/config.py/service_client_opts.
Then there is no need to write same codes in each client's file.

2. Delete the codes which re-registers config options to parameter 'conf'.
Because 'conf' is 'cfg.CONF' generally, except for the Swift which uses
individual config. And for Swift, register the opts in the config instance
to make sure 'conf' has been registered any opts needed before invoking
the 'create' method.

3. Move 'protection/utils.py' to 'protection/clients/utils.py'. Because
that file is only used by files in clients. Besides, add a new way to get
endpoint of service in utils.py/get_url.

4. Add a new way to create clients, which is by session and can solve the
bug that the token may expire during protecting works. Then we can create
client once and use it all the time(<48h) without worry that the token may
expire.

Change-Id: Iedf380cf7fd363af63357d2faded9a0fdd4ed5de
Implements: blueprint refactor-clients
Partial-Bug: #1566793

import exception from karbor.services.protection.clients import utils from karbor.tests import base class FakeKeystonePlugin(object): def __init__(self, endpoint): self.endpoint = endpoint def get_service_endpoint(self, service_name, service_type, region): return self.endpoint class ClientUtilsTest(base.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(ClientUtilsTest, self).setUp() self._service = '' self._public_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:8776/v3/abcd' service_catalog = [ {'type': 'volumev3', 'name': 'cinderv3', 'endpoints': [{'publicURL': self._public_url}], }, ] self._context = = 'http://127.0.0.1:8776/v3' get_opt.return_value = endpoint self.assertEqual( endpoint, utils.get_url(self._service, self._context, cfg.CONF)) self.assertEqual( endpoint + '/%s' % self._context, cfg.CONF)

Spec: use trust in the long time work flow

Change-Id: I7b81e3a7a66408195e7fdf8da4cff8edeb7ea557
Implements: blueprint use-trust-in-long-time-flow
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/08/387808/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Checkpoint scheduled clean ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/karbor/+spec/checkpoint-scheduled-clean Problem description =================== In the protect service, there are two situations to use the client of other openstack services. One is for ephemeral operation, such as using protectable plugins to list resources. The other one is for long time operation, such as using protect plugins to protect resources. The protect work flow uses the token passed from context and will be expired in a certain amount of time to create the client of other openstack service. Unfortunately, The work flow may fail if it requires more time than the token's life time. Use Cases ========= In the protect/restore/delete work flow which will run a long time, create a trust of user firstly when the flow starts, and then use it to get the token. When the token is expired soon during the flow, get a new token by the trust again. Proposed change =============== 1. Add a new class named 'OpenstackClients' in the protect service. When the work flow starts, create an instance of 'OpenstackClients' and pass it as a parameter to the methods of protect plugin, such as 'create_backup', 'delete_backup' etc. class CinderProtectionPlugin(BaseProtectionPlugin): def create_backup(self, cntxt, checkpoint, kwargs): clients = kwargs.get("openstack_clients") 2. The methods of protect plugin can get a client of other openstack service by the 'client' method of 'OpenstackClients', not by 'ClientFactory'. class OpenstackClients: def client(name): """return a client with valid token by the client's name""" 3. At each time accessing other openstack service, the plugin's methods must use 'client' method to get a client again. Because the 'client' method will check whether the token is expired soon, and if it is, get a new token and return a new client. Take the following codes for example. @property def _cinder_client(self): return self.clients.client('cinder') right codes: backup = self._cinder_client.backups.create() while True: backup_info = self._cinder_client.backups.get(backup.id) if backup_info.status == "available": break wrong codes: cinder_client = self._cinder_client backup = cinder_client.backups.create() while True: backup_info = cinder_client.backups.get(backup.id) if backup_info.status == "available": break Alternatives ------------ Currently, it should be no other good ways to solve this question. Karbor needs the client of other services to do the long time work. So, it is the key to insure the clients are valid during the process of work flow. Data model impact ----------------- Add a new class named 'OpenstackClients' in the protect service REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Getting token from keystone might cause a slight performance impact for the work flow Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- None Work Items ---------- * Add a 'OpenstackClients' class * Using it in the protect plugins * Write tests Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests in Karbor Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-10 12:00:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/searchlight/commit/c4af077d7d01d3d7d030f129a89b0ca38e47e13f', 'message': "Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Aodh. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Aodh.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Aodh, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: I79ef2f9340dd6b0c6eab8079fd5495f619d99adf
Closes-bug: #1590608

commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Searchlight.
The purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly
in case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Searchlight.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Searchlight, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will
show 'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: I79ef2f9340dd6b0c6eab8079fd5495f619d99adf
Closes-bug: #1590608
Co-Authored-By: abdul nizamuddin <abdul.nizamuddin@nectechnologies.in>

commit_message:
Patch for fixing hardware.memory.used metric

Change SNMP 'hardware.memory.used' metric
to reflect (memTotalReal - memAvailReal) which is the used value
for the memory for a physical machine.

This has to be done as SNMP does not provide a memory metric
for used that can be directly used.

Closes-Bug: #1321537

Change-Id: Ibd8cd38ef15a9e86ccd942412b80e90e3762dd44

commit_message:
Add SingleCellSimple fixture

This fixture makes it trivial to mock out all the cell listing stuff
for the simple case where you just want to assume a single cell that
is configured as the default database.

Change-Id: I7eecee388780677d2b342556fef0179b02707f3c

commit_message:
Add changes for dib feature/v2 branch

With diskimage-builder v2 branch, lib is nested on
diskimage_builder directory, so add this to the
search of paths to get that env var.

We also need to export IMAGE_ELEMENT_YAML var, and
generate get_image_element_array from elements.

Change-Id: I6974c5af6e8a53e49036f0cab489c7ac6bc979da

commit_message:
Disable broken horizon integration tests

The PTL of horizon asked me to help make these jobs non-voting
as they are currently not passing. Further these jobs are already
non-voting against master.

This is a regression against the stable branches which in all reality
is unlikely to get the attention of developers to ever turn it back
on. I have not investigate why the job is no longer functional.

For those reasons I'd like the PTL of stable and PTL of Horizon to
approve this change.

Change-Id: I6522a98cfca321c18be56f1970ba51098fd1b58d

commit_message:
Move the most contents of the top-level README.rst to docs

Recently added governance badges made "tox -e docs" target fail.
Fix it by stopping including the top-level README.rst from docs.
Instead, move the most of README.rst contents under the docs
directory, which is more appropriate place for them.

Closes-Bug: #1647555
Change-Id: I9d08a1f405d4ff377c2fc3f1c288ae9a7d982629
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/51/407351/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============================== Installation and configuration ============================== Supported MidoNet versions -------------------------- The current set of supported versions of MidoNet are: - v5.x NOTE: MidoNet changed its versioning scheme. v5.0 is what used to be called v2015.09. How to Install -------------- For productional deployments, we recommend to use a package for your distribution if available:: http://builds.midonet.org/ You can install the plugin from the source code by running the following command:: $ sudo python setup.py install The plugin requires python-midonetclient package, which is usually available along with other midonet packages. It's recommended to use the same version of python-midonetclient and midonet-cluster. Alternatively, you can install python-midonetclient from source:: $ sudo pip install -e 'git://github.com/midonet/midonet.git@master#egg=midonetclient&subdirectory=python-midonetclient' Core plugin ----------- ML2 mechanism and type drivers ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ networking-midonet is compatible with ML2 plugin. ML2 mechanism driver and type drivers for MidoNet are available:: [DEFAULT] core_plugin = ml2 [ml2] tenant_network_types = midonet type_drivers = midonet,uplink mechanism_drivers = midonet MidoNet monolithic plugin ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This plugin is provided for compatibility reasons. It's recommended to use ML2 plugin with MidoNet drivers instead. The following entry in ``/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`` enables MidoNet as the Neutron plugin:: [DEFAULT] core_plugin = midonet_v2 L3 service plugin ----------------- networking-midonet uses its own L3 service plugin:: [DEFAULT] service_plugins = midonet_l3 Interaction with Neutron agents ------------------------------- No Neutron agents are necessary for networking-midonet. You can configure networking-midonet work with Neutron DHCP and Metadata agents. But it isn't recommended anymore. For details, please refer to MidoNet documentation:: https://docs.midonet.org .. _interface-driver: Interface driver ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Neutron agents use `interface driver` to connect themselves into the datapath. In case of MidoNet, they should be configured with the MidoNet interface driver.:: [DEFAULT] interface_driver = midonet FWaaS ----- MidoNet implements Neutron FWaaS extention API. To configure it, add the following service plugin to the `service_plugins` list in the DEFAULT section of ``/etc/neutron/neutron.conf``:: [DEFAULT] service_plugins = midonet_firewall NOTE: No need to configure `Firewall Driver` at all. It's irrelevant because this plugin does not use Neutron L3 agent. LBaaS v2 -------- MidoNet plugin provides LBaaS v2 service driver. Note: the backend support is not available yet. It's planned for MidoNet 5.4. To configure it, add the following entries in the Neutron configuration file ``/etc/neutron/neutron.conf``:: [DEFAULT] service_plugins = lbaasv2 [service_providers] service_provider=LOADBALANCERV2:Midonet:midonet.neutron.services.loadbalancer.v2_driver.MidonetLoadBalancerDriver:default VPNaaS ------ Starting v5.1, MidoNet implements Neutron VPNaaS extension API. MidoNet plugin implements VPNaaS as a service driver. To configure it, add the following entries in the Neutron configuration file ``/etc/neutron/neutron.conf``:: [DEFAULT] service_plugins = vpnaas [service_providers] service_provider=VPN:Midonet:midonet.neutron.services.vpn.service_drivers.midonet_ipsec.MidonetIPsecVPNDriver:default NOTE: This plugin does not use Neutron VPNaaS agent. Gateway Device Service ---------------------- Starting v5.1, MidoNet implements Gateway Device Service vendor extension API. To configure it, add the following service plugin to the `service_plugins` list in the DEFAULT section of `/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`:: [DEFAULT] service_plugins = midonet_gwdevice L2 Gateway Service ------------------ Starting v5.1, MidoNet implements Neutron L2 Gateway Service extension API. The implementation differs slightly from upstream. Please check the following spec to see the differences: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/networking-midonet/specs/mitaka/border_gw.html MidoNet plugin implements L2 Gateway Service as a service driver. To configure it, add the following service plugin to the `service_plugins` list in the DEFAULT section of `/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`:: [DEFAULT] service_plugins = midonet_l2gw In addition, configure the service provider in the 'service_providers' section of L2 Gateway plugin configuration file `/etc/neutron/l2gw_plugin.ini`:: [service_providers] service_provider = L2GW:Midonet:midonet.neutron.services.l2gateway.service_drivers.l2gw_midonet.MidonetL2gwDriver:default Magnum ------ Starting v5.2, MidoNet can be used for Magnum deployment with the following workaround. Note: MidoNet doesn't provide LBaaS v2 functionality. You may need to disable it in your template. BGP dynamic routing service --------------------------- Starting v5.2, MidoNet implements Neutron BGP dynamic routing service extension API. The implementation differs from upstream as follows: - Router that is treated as bgp-speaker can be specified explicitly. - Bgp-peer can relate to only one bgp-speaker. - Binding network to bgp-speaker must be done before associating peers. - Removing network from bgp-speaker must be done after all peers are disassociated from the bgp-speaker. - Only one network can be associated with a bgp-speaker. - Advertise_floating_ip_host_routes and advertise_tenant_networks are ignored. - Attached network to the router and destination network in extra routes on the router are showed as advertised routes. To configure it, add the following service plugin to the `service_plugins` list in the DEFAULT section of `/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`:: [DEFAULT] service_plugins = midonet_bgp Logging Resource Service ------------------------ Starting v5.2, MidoNet implements Neutron Logging Resource Service extension API. To configure it, add the following service plugin to the `service_plugins` list in the DEFAULT section of `/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`:: [DEFAULT] service_plugins = midonet_logging_resource Firewall log is managed by Quota. Default value of firewall log is 10 that is same number as firewall. Basically, both Quota value for firewall and firewall log should be aligned. To tune it, change value of `quota_firewall_log` in the quotas section of `/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`. Tap-as-a-Service ---------------- Starting v5.2, MidoNet implements Tap-as-a-Service extension API. MidoNet plugin implements TaaS as a service driver. To configure it, add the following entries in the Neutron configuration file `/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`:: [DEFAULT] service_plugins = taas In addition, configure the service provider in the 'service_providers' section of TaaS plugin configuration file `/etc/neutron/taas_plugin.ini`:: [service_providers] service_provider = TAAS:Midonet:midonet.neutron.services.taas.service_drivers.taas_midonet.MidonetTaasDriver:default QoS --- With the latest development version of MidoNet, networking-midonet supports Neutron QoS extension. QoS service plugin ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ QoS service plugin can be configured in the Neutron server configuration file `/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`:: [DEFAULT] service_plugins = qos [qos] notification_drivers = midonet QoS core resource extension for ML2 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ QoS core resource extension for ML2 plugin can be configured in the Neutron server configuration file `/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`:: [ml2] extension_drivers = qos QoS core resource extension for v2 plugin ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ No configuration is necessary. Horizon ------- Starting with Newton, Horizon has built-in support for MidoNet network types. To enable it, add the following configuration to the `OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK` dict in `local_settings.py`:: 'supported_provider_types': ['midonet', 'uplink'],
deleted_lines: ============ Installation ============ At the command line:: $ pip install networking-midonet Or, if you have virtualenvwrapper installed:: $ mkvirtualenv networking-midonet $ pip install networking-midonet

commit_message:
gate_hook: Add "full" variants of ml2 and v2

At this point, they are identical with the non-full variants.
The plan is to introduce new non-voting jobs for these and
make the existing voting jobs minimum later.

Change-Id: Ib64ed914a3242c27876ae2702079ad38c3d41204
Partial-Bug: #1615668
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/38/404138/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
v2-full) # Note the actual url here is somewhat irrelevant because it # caches in nodepool, however make it a valid url for # documentation purposes. export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG="enable_plugin networking-midonet git://git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-midonet" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'

'"TEMPEST_RUN_VALIDATION=True" # Enable MidoNet v2 architecture export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"MIDONET_PLUGIN=midonet.neutron.plugin_v2.MidonetPluginV2" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"MIDONET_CLIENT=midonet.neutron.client.api.MidonetApiClient" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"Q_SERVICE_PLUGIN_CLASSES=midonet.neutron.services.l3.l3_midonet.MidonetL3ServicePlugin" _ML2=False ;; ml2-full) # Note the actual url here is somewhat irrelevant because it # caches in nodepool, however make it a valid url for # documentation purposes. export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG="enable_plugin networking-midonet git://git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-midonet" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'

'"TEMPEST_RUN_VALIDATION=True" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'

'"ML2_L3_PLUGIN=midonet.neutron.services.l3.l3_midonet.MidonetL3ServicePlugin" _ML2=True ;;

commit_message:
devstack: Workaround q-trunk issue

Neutron devstack plugin automatically enables q-trunk
while we don't support it.
As a workaround, disable it explicity.

Related-Bug: #1643451
Change-Id: Ic3e68d48ffc14a885eba4d0a8c81cf73f1eea659

commit_message:
Fix SSL and verbose issue of zaqar bench

Currently, Zaqar bench doesn't pass insecure or cert when build
Zaqar client which cause it doesn't work with SSL. This patch
fix it and also deprecates the 'verbose' option which is replaced
with 'debug'.

Closes-Bug: #1607124

Change-Id: I7411b9a310abb5e51f91bac0766a6fe7d684741c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/07/348107/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.BoolOpt('debug', default=True, help=('Tag to indicate if print the details of running.')),

commit_message:
Add a TODO item for oslo.messaging version bump

The oslo.messaging version bump from 5.2.0 to 5.14.0 is a big thing.
Although it is not breaking our code so far, we should review the
changes to the library and see if there are things we need to change in
order to leverage its new feature and/or fix improper usage.

Change-Id: Ifcc34a44266d476e9d957f53da820704b79156e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/75/408375/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Post Xenial switch adaptations

Moving to Xenial revealed a problem
with mixing bindep and devstack.
The bindep actually came from using the
install-distro-packages 'builder' which
we do not really want.

Adding devstack logs while at it.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Id899fc206f8f975abc6c63a034edbd8257e5fdde

subject: Be robust on deleting a non-existing sandbox
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 23:02:36.000000000', 'files': ['zun/container/docker/driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zun/commit/8c0ba771e52b995142606fc9b6c0093d779b91bc', 'message': 'Be robust on deleting a non-existing sandbox

If there is an error on create, the sandbox might not be there.
Then, if users delete the container later, zun will try to delete
an non-existing sandbox container, which raised an unexpected
exception. This commit handles this corner case.

Change-Id: I84dad0f95ed026a2a9c4e87552c0f457fd07ac37
'}]
commit_message:
Be robust on deleting a non-existing sandbox

If there is an error on create, the sandbox might not be there.
Then, if users delete the container later, zun will try to delete
an non-existing sandbox container, which raised an unexpected
exception. This commit handles this corner case.

Change-Id: I84dad0f95ed026a2a9c4e87552c0f457fd07ac37
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/42/408342/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: docker.remove_container(sandbox_id, force=True) except errors.APIError as api_error: if '404' in str(api_error): return raise

commit_message:
correct ceilometer command for neutron l3 metering sample

Ceilometer stores notifications from neutron-metering-agent as
meter named bandwidth, but current document refers to hardware
meters which is wrong.

Change-Id: Iac2fb25cf6cf9f38676de87f0c9e7934526aaee3
Closes-Bug: #1318604
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/48/393248/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ ceilometer sample-list -m bandwidth -q metadata.label_id=ea0da2d8-e077-4440-a11e-28089faa6fdb
deleted_lines: $ ceilometer sample-list -m SNMP_MEASUREMENT For example: .. code-block:: console $ ceilometer sample-list -m hardware.network.bandwidth.bytes $ ceilometer sample-list -m hardware.network.incoming.bytes $ ceilometer sample-list -m hardware.network.outgoing.bytes $ ceilometer sample-list -m hardware.network.outgoing.errors

commit_message:
Support Gnocchi actions in mistral

In the new version of the ceilometer(ocata), Ceilometer API is
deprecated. So when the user uses gnocchi to store the monitoring
data, the operations related to the monitoring data in the
ceilometer action will not take effect. So gnocchi actions are
added.

Change-Id: Ia5dfb9e26861b0ceb993ec3a924bd27d5433c8db
Implements: blueprint mistral-gnocchi-actions

commit_message:
Add tests for the availability of individual backends

These will either pass if the backend is available, or skip if it isn't.
What we definitely *don't* want is a situation where someone runs tests,
sees all passes with no skips, and assumes they must therefore have all
backends available.

Change-Id: I1d2c691d01f38d5e8f7bc9cf4ec4b9c50ace32b9

added_lines: class TestBackendsEnabled(unittest.TestCase): '''Based on TestPyECLibDriver.test_valid_algo above, but these tests should *always* either pass or skip.''' class __metaclass__(type): def __new__(meta, cls_name, cls_bases, cls_dict): for ec_type in ALL_EC_TYPES: def dummy(self, ec_type=ec_type): if ec_type not in VALID_EC_TYPES: raise unittest.SkipTest k, m = 10, 4 if ec_type == 'shss' else 5 ECDriver(k=k, m=m, ec_type=ec_type) dummy.__name__ = 'test_%s_available' % ec_type cls_dict[dummy.__name__] = dummy return type.__new__(meta, cls_name, cls_bases, cls_dict)
